thread.title: US relax restrictions Cuba, business and tourism opportunities openedTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: US relax restrictions Cuba, business and tourism opportunities openedTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: US relax restrictions Cuba, business and tourism opportunities openedTravelandtourworld.com
text:
US relax restrictions Cuba, business and tourism opportunities opened Published on : Monday, September 21, 2015
In the latest action to weaken the trade embargo, the United States issued regulations on Friday easing restrictions on US companies seeking to do business in Cuba and opening up travel.
The new regulations come into effect from Monday (Sept 21) and allow US companies to establish a presence in Cuba. These target travel, telecommunications, Internet-based services, business operations and banking, and allow US companies to establish a presence in Cuba. They also eliminate limits on the amount of money people can send back to the Caribbean nation.
The two neighboring countries restored diplomatic ties and reopened embassies earlier this summer.
Friday’s regulations build on others President Barack Obama announcement in January to ease the 53-year-old embargo against Cuba.
Officials said while the changes are aimed at expanding business, they also seek to boost so-called “people-to-people” contact between Americans and Cubans.
Washington and Havana move toward normal relations between the one-time Cold War foes for the first time in more than half a century.
